content.description: The crux is pulling through the slot in the roof.  It is a fun route using edges around a seam to a slot in the roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  The anchor with two bolts is 6 feet back.  Long slings are needed for TR.
content.location: This is #4 in the photo.  Follow line of bolts near a prominant seam/crack.  Walk off or rap.

content.description: The crux is leaving the ledge at the 4th bolt.  Pull onto the face with good holds then slab up and right to a good stance.  It is runout a bit to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with snap links.
content.location: This is #5 in the photo.  Find the line of bolts on a face between two crack/seams.  Walk off or rap.

content.description: This is one route with two starts.  The left start crux is 5.8 at the first bolt.  The right start crux is also at the other first bolt and is 10a.  The 10a start is nice pulling and laying back off a thin seam to a good stance 15 feet up.  Continue up the face with good holds to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with snap links at the top.
content.location: These are #7A and 7B in the photo.  Find the 8 inch wide quartz runnel that starts ground level and goes up and right.  Climb the 5.8 start beginning in the runnel or the alternate start on the face to the right utilizing the seams and edges.

content.description: This has a slabby crux right off the ground and going up the roof at the last bolt.  It is a short, fun route.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2 bolt acchor with snap links at the top.
content.location: This is #8 in the photo.  This is the rightmost route on the rock.  Walk off or rap.

content.description: The crux is at the 2nd bolt. Grab on the dark plates and work straight up the line of bolts.  Traverse up and right after the last bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  The anchor is 6 feet back off face.  You need a long sling to TR.
content.location: This is #1 in the photo.  It is the leftmost route on the rock.  Walk off or rap.

content.description: The crux is near the top after last bolt.  It has some loose stuff.
content.location: This is #2 in the photo.  It is the second line of bolts from the left.  Walk off or rap.

content.description: The crux is at the start and the 4th bolt.  This is a very fun climb up a seam/shallow dihedral.  Start with good edges and pockets past the 1st bolt.  Gain the shallow dihedral and continue up. It is a bit runout to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with snap links at the top.
content.location: This is #6 on photo.  Follow the seam up the middle of a section covered with orange lichen.  Walk off or rap.

content.description: The crux is pulling the roof at the last bolt.  Climb a slabby face to a ledge with a good stance.  Finish with a boulder problem out the roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts. The anchors are at the top 6 feet back from edge.  Longer slings are needed for TR.
content.location: This is #3 in the photo.  Follow the line of 3 bolts near a thin seam to the roof.
